Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus (IC50=7.4 µg/ml).Fungi:Candida albicans (IC50=3.0 µg/ml), Pichia pastoris (IC50=0.1 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Exhibits stronger antimicrobial activity against the Gram-positive bacterium S. aureus and fungi C. albicans and P. pastoris than Gram-negative bacterium E. coli. Binds to chitin (4.3 µM are required to obtain 50% of binding). Does not cause hemolysis on sheep erythrocytes. Has no blocking activity on the P-type calcium channel.
Sequence Information.Domain: The presence of a 'disulfide through disulfide knot' structurally defines this protein as a knottin.

Literature.Title: Horseshoe crab hemocyte-derived antimicrobial polypeptides, tachystatins, with sequence similarity to spider neurotoxins.
Literature.Author: Osaki T, Omotezako M, Nagayama R, Hirata M, Iwanaga S, Kasahara J, Hattori J, Ito I, Sugiyama H, Kawabata S.

Literature.Title: The solution structure of horseshoe crab antimicrobial peptide tachystatin B with an inhibitory cystine-knot motif.
Literature.Author: Fujitani N, Kouno T, Nakahara T, Takaya K, Osaki T, Kawabata S, Mizuguchi M, Aizawa T, Demura M, Nishimura S, Kawano K.
